questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 has full term labour patient was given epidural analgesia for vaginal delivery. What should be the ideal level of epidural to achieve painless labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

T10

The ideal level for epidural analgesia is T10 for vaginal delivery. It can be given even in the latent stage of labour. Hypotension and coagulopathy are contraindications.

questions.text: The following sonographical finding was seen in a patient who came to the clinic for evaluation of infertility. This kind of picture of endometrium is due to presence of which hormone?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Estrogen 

In this picture, the endometrium shows trilaminar pattern which is seen due to proliferative phase of endometrial cycle. Estrogen is considered as proliferative hormone and this picture is due to estrogen. This is seen in mid cycle.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a component of broad ligament?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ureter

Broad ligament contains uterine vessels, ovarian vessels, cornual structures like round ligament, broad ligament and fallopian tube. Broad ligament also contains remnant of mesonephric ducts. Ureter is below the broad ligament. It is not a component of broad ligament.

questions.text: A 27 years old female had CA 125 levels of higher than normal range. Which one of the following is not a reason of raised C125 levels?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

PCOS

CA 125 is a marker of serous pathology like peritonitis, tuberculosis, serous cyst adenocarcinoma etc.  It is also raised in pregnancy, menstruation and endometriosis. PCOS is not a serous pathology hence CA 125 is normal in PCOS.

questions.text: Which one of the following findings in the endometrial biopsy is not consistent with estrogenic activity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sub nuclear vacuolation 

Estrogen causes proliferative changes in the endometrium, it increases endometrial thickness, it causes pseudo stratification. Estrogen does not cause secretory changes like sub-nuclear vacuolation.

choices.text: The most common site of carcinoma of cervix is transformation zone
Minimum cervical length in reproductive age group is 2.5 cm
Cervix to corpus ratio in reproductive group should be 3:1
Estrogen is responsible for proliferation of endo cervical glands leading to more lubrication.

questions.text: Which one of the following things is not correct about cervix?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cervix to corpus ratio in reproductive group should be 3:1 

Cervix has an average length of 3.5-4 cm. Minimum cervical length is 2.5 cm. Corpus-cervix ratio is 3:1 so cervix to corpus ratio is 1:3 in reproductive age group. The most common site of carcinoma of cervix is transformation zone, especially the anterior lip. The most common ca-cervix is squamous cell carcinoma. Estrogen is predominant in middle part of the cycle. It causes proliferation of endocervical glands and hence it helps in increasing lubrication of vagina.

questions.text: Which one of the following is an incorrect pair?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Uterus --- Mesonephric duct 

Uterus originates from paramesonephric ducts also called as Mullerian ducts.

questions.text: Identify the structure shown with an arrow mark in the given picture:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Tertiary follicle

The arrow is pointing to tertiary follicle which is also called as antral follicle. It is identified by the presence of fluid in the follicular cavity.

choices.text: Estradiol is produced by theca cells under the influence of LH
Ttestosterone is produced by granulosa cells under the influence of LH
Estradiol is produced from granulosa cells under the influence of FSH
Testosterone is produced by the theca cells under the influence of FSH

questions.text: Amongst the given statements about steroidogenesis of ovary, which one of the following is correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Estradiol is produced from granulosa cells under the influence of FSH 

Estrogen is produced from granulosa cells due to FSH. The raw material required for making estrogen is obtained from theca cells. Theca cells produce androgens under the influence of LH. In the second half of cycle, granulosa cells start producing progesterone due to LH-surge which occurs in mid cycle.

questions.text: Which one of the following hormones is not produced by ovary?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Dihydrotestosterone

Ovary can produce androgens like androstenedione, testosterone and dehydroepiandrostenedione but ovaries cannot produce dihydrotestosterone due to absence of 5 alpha reductase.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a risk factor for the development of fibroid uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Smoking 

Fibroid uterus is an estrogenic condition. Smoking reduces estrogen levels in the body so smokers have less risk of estrogenic conditions like fibroid uterus, preeclampsia, endometrial hyperplasia and cancer of endometrium.

choices.text: The most common fibroid is submucous fibroid
The most symptomatic fibroid is sub-serous fibroid
The most common symptom is pain
Torsion is a complication of Figo-7 type of fibroid

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about fibroid uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Torsion is a complication of Figo-7 type of fibroid 

The most common type of fibroid is intramural fibroid. The most symptomatic fibroid is submucosal fibroid. The most common presentation is asymptomatic. The most common symptom is abnormal uterine bleeding. The pattern of AUB is menorrhagia. FIGO-7 fibroid is sub-serosal pedunculated type of fibroid. It may undergo torsion and can cause acute pain in abdomen.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a symptom of fibroid?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Fibroid can cause AUB, dysmenorrhoea, pressure symptoms, infertility, RPL, anemia, and very rare symptom would be polycythaemia. Fibroid cannot cause dyspareunia.

questions.text: A 27 years old female has developed endometriosis of ovary. She has eight cm sized chocolate cyst. She is nullipara patient with dysmenorrhoea since last five years. What is the best line of treatment in this case medical management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Laparoscopic cystectomy 

Endometriosis with chocolate cyst of 8 cm size would mean severe endometriosis. The correct treatment in a case of endometriosis with anatomical distortion is laparoscopic surgery and in this case cystectomy. Medical management is reserved for minimal to mild endometriosis.

questions.text: A 15 years old female has imperforate hymen. She has cyclic pelvic pain with no menarche till now. She may develop endometriosis based on which theory?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Sampson theory 

Imperforate hymen causes cryptomenorrhea. Accumulation of menstruation would lead to retrograde menstruation leading to endometriosis in the pelvis and abdomen. This is retrograde menstruation theory of endometriosis. It is also called as Sampson theory.

questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 has full term labour patient, she was given epidural analgesia. When would we declare this case as a case of prolonged second stage of labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

After 3 hours

2nd stage of labour is considered as prolonged if three hours have passed in a nulliparous patient or two hours have passed in a multiparous patient. In any patient who has taken epidural for pain relief during labour, one hour waiting period is added because epidural analgesia prolongs the second stage of labour. In this question, the patient is multiparous and epidural analgesia was given so the correct answer for prolonged second stage of labour is B: after three hours.

questions.text: The following sonographical finding was seen in a patient who came to the clinic for evaluation of infertility. This kind of picture of endometrium is due to presence of which hormone?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Progesterone 

In this picture, uterus is seen in sagittal view. There is a singular endometrial layer which is thickened as well. This picture is due to secretory phase of endometrial cycle. Secretary hormone is progesterone.

questions.text: Highest level of prolactin hormone is seen during which one of the following phases?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Labour

Highest level of prolactin hormone is seen during labour. After delivery, prolactin will reduce due to loss of estrogen however prolactin will start working due to withdrawal of hormones from the body. Lactating mother has less prolactin than labouring mother but lactating mother has functional prolactin.

questions.text: Which one of the following findings in the endometrial biopsy is/are consistent with progesteronic activity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above

Progesterone is a secretory hormone. It increases vascularity of endometrium as well as nutrition of endometrium. Sub nuclear vacuolation is due to formation of glycogen caused by secretory changes. Progesterone causes cork screwing of glands as well so the correct answer is D.

choices.text: It is made up of two Mullerian Ducts
Lower segment of uterus is formed by urogenital sinus
Uterine artery supplies blood to the body and the cervix of the uterus
Lymphatics from cornual region drain into superficial inguinal lymph nodes

questions.text: Which one of the following things about uterus is not correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Lower segment of uterus is formed by urogenital sinus

Uterus is made up of two Mullerian Ducts. Urogenital sinus is not responsible for formation of any part of uterus. Uterine artery supplies blood to the body and the cervix of the uterus which would consist of 80% part of the uterus. Ovarian artery supplies blood to the fundal region of the uterus. Lymphatic drainage from the fundal region goes to para-aortic lymph nodes, from the body to iliac lymph nodes, from the cornual region to the superficial inguinal lymph nodes.

choices.text: It makes testosterone in male fetus
It makes thyroid hormone and pregnancy

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a function of hCG?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

It is a luteolytic hormone

HCG is a glycoprotein. It is produced by syncitiotrophoblast. It is luteotropic hormone. It prevents immune-rejection and it makes testosterone in male foetus and thyroid hormone in pregnancy. It is related to LH FSH and TSH.

questions.text: While doing sonography in early pregnancy we see double decidual sac sign. What are the two structures making the same?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Decidua Capsularis and Decidua parietalis

Double decidual sac sign is formed in early pregnancy. It is made up of decidua capsularis and decidua parietalis. It gives appearance of a ring inside a bigger ring. Inner ring is a true gestational sac covered by decidua capsularis.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common cause of early pregnancy bleeding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Abortion 

Abortion is the most common cause of early pregnancy haemorrhage. 15 to 16 percent pregnancies get aborted, 3% pregnancies are ectopic pregnancies. Molar pregnancy occurs in 1:80 to 1:160 pregnancies. Abruptio placenta is a cause of late pregnancy bleeding.

choices.text: The most common site of ectopic pregnancy is ampulla of fallopian tube
Earliest site to get ruptured in ectopic pregnancy is isthmus of the tube
Rarest type of ectopic pregnancy is caesarean scar ectopic
The most common cause of ectopic pregnancy is endometriosis

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about ectopic pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The most common cause of ectopic pregnancy is endometriosis

The most common site of ectopic pregnancy is ampulla of the fallopian tube. 55 to 60% of all tubal ectopic pregnancies are ampullary ectopic pregnancies. Isthmic ectopic gets ruptured at sixth week of gestation. It is the earliest site to get ruptured. Caesarean scar ectopic is the rarest type of ectopic. Early pregnancy requires medical management and advanced pregnancy requires scar excision and repair. The most common cause of ectopic pregnancy is pelvic inflammatory disease.

questions.text: Which one of the following pregnancies is normal?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Angular pregnancy

Angular pregnancy is a physiological pregnancy. It occurs due to implantation of the zygote on the lateral wall of uterus instead of posterior wall near fundus. It is also called as PISKACEK sign. All other pregnancies given in the question are pathological pregnancies.

questions.text: 27 years old G2P1L1 has come with eight weeks of missed-period. She also has lower abdominal pain and vaginal spotting. Her UPT is positive. Which one of the following is the next step for diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Trans vaginal sonography 

The investigation of choice in a suspected case of ectopic pregnancy is ultrasonography. We may be able to see gestational sac outside the uterus or a complex adnexal mass with ring-of-fire appearance. This will help us in the diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy.

choices.text: Give oral iron plus injectable iron therapy
Continue one IFA pill per day

questions.text: A 29 years old primigravida has iron deficiency anemia of 8 gm%. She is 32 weeks pregnant. She is taking one IFA pill per day and her vitals are stable. What should be the best line of treatment in such case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Give two IFA per day 

In this case, there is moderate anaemia in early third trimester this can be treated by oral iron therapy. It consists of 2 IFA pills per day. Had there been late third trimester, injectable iron therapy would have been a better answer but in this case the correct answer is oral iron therapy.

questions.text: How much is the total iron requirement in whole pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1000 mg 

The total amount of iron required in whole pregnancy is 1000 mg. 300 milligram goes to the foetus, 500 milligram is required for development of maternal RBCs. And 200 milligram is lost through urine, sweat and faecal material.

choices.text: 60 mg iron and 500 µg folic acid
Hundred milligram iron and 500 µg folic acid
120 mg iron and 1000 µg folic acid
Hundred milligram iron and 1000 µg folic acid

questions.text: Asper anemia Mukta Bharat program if there is mild anemia at 24 weeks of gestation then how much amount of iron and folic acid should be given to the pregnant patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

120 mg iron and 1000 µg folic acid 

Mild anaemia at 24 weeks of gestation would require oral iron therapy which is made up of two IFA pills per day. Each IFA-pill contains 60 milligram elemental iron and 500 micrograms of folic acid so the total dose required is 120 mg iron and 1000 microgram of folic acid.

choices.text: Advise her to shift to safer anti-epileptic like lamotrigine
Advise her to continue the same drug and start folic acid 4000 µg per day
Advise her to switch over to safer anti-epileptic and start folic acid 4000 µg per day

questions.text: At 28 years old gravida-two, para-one, living-one has history of epilepsy for which she is taking Valproate. She is eight weeks pregnant now. What should be the best line of management in such case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Advise her to continue the same drug and start folic acid 4000 µg per day 

Changing the medication during pregnancy may trigger convulsion which would be riskier than the drug itself. Hence it is advisable to continue the same medication and give folic acid 4000 microgram per day.

choices.text: FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%
FBS >= 95mg% or 2Hr BS >= 180 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%
FBS >= 92mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%
FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 180 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

questions.text: Which one of the following is correct regarding diagnosis of overt diabetes in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

As per American Diabetes Association, overt diabetes is diagnosed if any one of the following investigations is abnormal. The three investigations are: FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

choices.text: Check blood sugar level at the end of two hours
Abandon the test and do it the next day
Check blood sugar level immediately and after two hours

questions.text: While performing DIPSI test in a patient at 16 weeks of gestation it was noted that patient vomited the glucose solution after 10 minutes of intake. What should be the next line of management in such case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Abandon the test and do it the next day 

DIPSI test is done by giving 75 gm glucose in a glass of water and if the patient vomits this solution within 30 minutes then the test is abandoned for the day. It is repeated on some other day. If patient vomits after 30 minutes then the test is continued and blood sugar evaluation is done after two hours. If the value is more than or equal to 140 milligram percentage then the patient is labelled as a case of GDM.

questions.text: 26 years old primigravida has gestational diabetes mellitus which is well controlled on insulin therapy. When is the ideal time of delivery in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

40 weeks

Gestational diabetes mellitus requires dietary correction. If dietary correction is able to achieve the target blood sugar levels then pregnancy is continued and delivery is done between 39 to 40+6 weeks of gestation. If medications are required for blood sugar control then the delivery is done between 39 to 39+6 weeks of gestation. We must never deliver GDM before 39 weeks of gestation because there is risk RDS in the newborn. For this question, the correct answer would be D: 40 weeks.

questions.text: Calculate the dose of injection Anti-D in a patient who underwent manual removal of placenta. Her blood group was Rh negative, her baby's blood group was Rh positive and her ICT was 1:8. She delivered a full-term baby.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

No need of injection

This is a case of Rh-negative pregnancy with ICT value of 1:8. It means the patient is already iso-immunised. We cannot prevent iso-immunisation by giving injection ANTI-D. There is no need of giving injection in this case.

choices.text: Expected baby weight of 7th percentile in utero.
Fasting blood sugar level of 207 mg percentage in pregnancy
Rh negative pregnancy with ICT negative status
Primigravida, 32 weeks of gestation with BP of 160/90 mm Hg (twice)

questions.text: Which one of the following is not considered as a high-risk pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rh negative pregnancy with ICT negative status 

Expected baby weight of 7th percentile would mean foetal growth restriction, fasting blood sugar level of 207mg% would mean overt diabetes. BP of 160/90 would mean hypertension in pregnancy. All these conditions are high risk pregnancies. Rh-negative pregnancy with ICT negative status would mean non iso-immunised pregnancy. It is not considered as a high-risk pregnancy.

choices.text: Observe for development of rashes, if rashes develop then give acyclovir
Just do congenital anomalies scan and if there is no anomaly then continue pregnancy

questions.text: At 33 years old primigravida has had a chicken-pox exposure three days ago. She has no past immunity. Her IgG for varicella zoster is negative. She is 18 weeks pregnant. What is the next line of management in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Give her varicella zoster immunoglobulin 

Chicken pox exposure in pregnancy may cause congenital varicella syndrome. Highest risk of congenital varicella syndrome is seen between 13 to 20 weeks of gestation. In order to prevent this condition, we must give VZIG to the patient who is exposed to chicken pox during pregnancy.

choices.text: Give her DT vaccine now and one after four weeks
Give her DT vaccine now and one during labour
Only one DT vaccine is enough in this case
No need to give DT vaccine she since she has completed her full-term gestation

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida with full-term gestation has come to ante natal OPD at for the first ANC visit. She denies any history of DT vaccination in her pregnancy. What is the best plan of action in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Give her DT vaccine now and one after four weeks 

Non immunised patient must receive two doses of DT vaccine during pregnancy. The two doses must be given one month apart. Ideal time of giving DT vaccine is first visit.

questions.text: What is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Graves' disease 

The most common cause of hyperthyroidism in pregnancy is Grave’s disease. It is an autoimmune disease. Thyroid stimulating auto antibodies are found in the body. Serum TSH is the screening test of thyroid disorders in pregnancy.

questions.text: A 33 years old G3P2L2 has mitral stenosis with left atrial enlargement. When is the maximum risk of cardiac failure in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

immediate post-partum

There is maximum cardiac output in the immediate post-partum period. This is due to increase in the blood volume caused by contracted and retracted uterus. This may trigger CCF.

choices.text: Contraceptive failure with gestational age of 18 weeks
Pregnancy due to rape, with gestational age of 28 weeks
Anencephaly with gestational age of 27 weeks
Eisenmenger syndrome in the mother with gestational age of 12 weeks

questions.text: According to the MTP law, MTP cannot be done in which one of the following cases?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Pregnancy due to rape, with gestational age of 28 weeks 

According to the new law MTP can be done till 24 weeks of gestation. Contraceptive failure has a limit of 20 weeks. For gross congenital anomalies, there is no limit set. It means MTP can be done even after 24 weeks of gestation in a case of gross congenital anomaly like anencephaly. So, the correct answer to this question is B.

questions.text: The most common cause of abortion is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Chromosome abnormalities 

The most common cause of abortion is chromosomal abnormality in the embryo. It is responsible for 50

questions.text: At 27 years old female has continuous bleeding per vaginum since last 15 days. She has history of amenorrhoea for three months prior to it. On ultrasonographical examination, the following finding was seen. Her UPT is positive. What is the most likely karyotype of this pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

46XX 

This is a picture of snow storm appearance seen in ultrasound. It is due to complete molar pregnancy. Complete mole is formed due to fertilisation of an empty egg. There is monospermy diandry. It is always diploid but maternal chromosomes are absent. 90 to 95

questions.text: A 33 years old multiparous patient had molar pregnancy two months ago. She underwent section evacuation for the same. At present, she has developed bluish sub-urethral nodule of 2 cm size. Her hCG is 1,500,000 IU/L. She also has snowstorm appearance in the chest x-ray. What is your likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Choriocarcinoma 

Presence of bluish sub-urethral nodule is a marker of gestational trophoblastic neoplasm called as choriocarcinoma. There is vaginal metastasis as well as lung metastasis. It is a stage 3 gestational chorio-carcinoma.

choices.text: GTN after full term normal delivery
GTN in a 43 years old patient

questions.text: In case of GTN, which one of the following is a good prognostic marker?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Lung metastasis 

If GTN occurs after full term pregnancy then there is more likelihood of choriocarcinoma which has poor prognosis. GTN in a patient who is 40 years old has poor prognosis. Brain or liver metastases are also considered as poor prognostic GTNs. Lung is considered as most common site of metastasis in GTN. It is not qualified as poor prognostic cancer.

questions.text: Which one of the following patients would not require evaluation of APLA antibodies?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Gestational diabetes mellitus

APLA syndrome causes recurrent pregnancy losses, vascular thrombosis, one or more foetal deaths after 10 weeks of gestation. It is not associated with gestational diabetes mellitus.

choices.text: Helps in growth and development of fetus

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a function of amniotic fluid?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Provides nutrition to the fetus

Amniotic fluid provides space for the growth of the skeletal system as well as pulmonary system. It helps in balancing the pressure as well as temperature. It helps in providing lubrication during labour. Amniotic fluid has nutrients like glucose, amino acids etc but amniotic fluid has no nutritive function. Placenta is a source of nutrition for the foetus.

choices.text: It occurs after 20th week of gestation
It resolves within 12 weeks of delivery
There is proteinuria or end organ damage
It is more common in nulliparous patients

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about gestation hypertension?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

There is proteinuria or end organ damage 

Gestational hypertension would mean hypertension of 140/90 mm of Hg, two times, 12 weeks apart after 20th week of gestation. It resolves within 12 weeks of delivery. There is no element of significant proteinuria or end organ damage. Proteinuria or end organ damage would change the diagnosis to preeclampsia. HTN disorders are more common in nulliparous patients.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not included in McAfee Johnson regime of placenta previa management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cervical cerclage

McAfee Johnson regime of Placenta Previa is an expectant management of Placenta Previa. Pregnancy is continued till 37 weeks at higher centre, which means a centre where facility of caesarean section is available round-the-clock. We also give steroid therapy for improving lung maturity. If haemoglobin is less than 10 gm% then we give blood transfusion. If uterine contractions are present then we give tocolytic therapy as well. There is no role of cervical cerclage in this management.

questions.text: Identify the given placental pathology:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Velamentous placenta 

This is a picture of placenta with abnormal cord insertion. In this picture, you can clearly see that the cord is inserted in the membranes and membranes are carrying the vessels to placenta. Hence this is a picture of velamentous Placenta. It may lead to cord avulsion during 3rd stage of Labour. It may cause vasa previa in pregnancy.

choices.text: Most common type is placenta percreta
Most common cause is previous LSCS plus placenta previa

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about morbidly adherent placenta (placenta accreta syndrome)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

B and C

Morbidly adherent placenta is due to absence of Nitabuch’s layer in decidua basalis. The most common type is placenta accreta which is seen in 75% of the cases. The most common cause of this condition is previous LSCS with placenta previa. 80% of the cases are due to this condition.

questions.text: Mullerian inhibitory substance gene is located on which chromosome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chromosome number 19 

Mullerian inhibitory substance gene, also called MIS gene is located at the short arm of chromosome no. 19. Location is 19p13. AMHR 2 gene is receptor gene for MIS and it is located at chromosome number 12.

questions.text: For the development of male fetus SRY gene is very essential. Where is the location of this gene?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Short arm of Y chromosome 

SRY gene is also called sex determining region of Y chromosome gene. It is located at short arm of Y chromosome. If there is point mutation of this gene then it would lead to Swyer syndrome.

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs is not used in the treatment of precocious puberty?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Combined OC pills 

The treatment of choice for precautious puberty is GNRH analogue. Letrozole is used in Mc Cune Albright syndrome to reduce oestrogen production. Steroids are used in congenital adrenal hypoplasia. There is no role of combined oral contraceptive pills in the treatment of precocious puberty.

questions.text: Which one of the following is consistent with menopause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Serum FSH 65 IU/L 

In a case of menopause, there is an ovarian failure hence serum estradiol level would be less than 30 pg./ml and serum FSH would be more than or equal to 40 IU/L. There is hyper gonadotropic hypogonadism so LH levels will also be raised.

questions.text: Which one of the following is an absolute contraindication of progesterone therapy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Past history of breast cancer 

Progesterone therapy is not allowed in any patient who is a case of breast cancer or who has past history of breast cancer because there may be relapse of cancerous tissue. Progesterone is not contraindicated in patients with history of DVT or patients who have history of epilepsy or patients who are smokers.

choices.text: No menarche till the age of 15 years
No menarche and no secondary sexual characters till the age of 13 years
No menarche even after three years of attaining thelarche
All are correct definitions of primary amenorrhoea

questions.text: Which one of the following would be the definition of primary amenorrhoea?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are correct definitions of primary amenorrhoea

No menses till the age of 15 years or no secondary sexual character till the age of 13 years or no menses even after 3 years of attaining thelarche would be qualified as primary amenorrhea.

questions.text: Which one of the following has best prognosis amongst all the cases of uterine carcinoma?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Endometrioid adenocarcinoma

questions.text: A 32 years old female has intramural uterine fibroid and the uterine fundal height is at the level of umbilicus. This is causing frequent micturition. She has infertility as well. Which of the following is the best treatment for her?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Laparoscopic myomectomy 

This is the case of symptomatic fibroid. She has pressure symptoms because of large fibroid so we need to remove this fibroid from the uterus. Since it is an intramural fibroid, we need to remove it by laparoscopic myomectomy.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common clinical feature in a patient who has intrauterine fibroids?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Abnormal uterine bleeding 

Most of the fibroids are asymptomatic. Most common symptom of fibroid is abnormal uterine bleeding. The most common pattern is menorrhagia.

choices.text: Lubrication of vagina by increasing endocervical glands
Positive feedback on pituitary for release of LH
Proliferation of basal and parabasal cells of vagina epithelium

questions.text: Which of the following actions is not estrogenic in nature?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Proliferation of basal and parabasal cells of vagina epithelium

Estrogen is responsible for proliferation of endocervical glands and hence it causes lubrication of vagina in mid cycle. Estrogen is responsible for giving positive feedback on the brain to cause LH surge. Estrogen causes growth of breasts during pregnancy. It is called as mammogenesis and estrogen is responsible for proliferation of superficial cells of vaginal epithelium. Basal and parabasal cells are not dependent on hormones.

questions.text: Which one of the following instruments is not used during laparoscopy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Instrument labelled as A is TROCAR and CANNULA, instrument labelled as B is veress needle. These instruments are used for creating the port in the abdomen. Instrument labelled as C is SIMS speculum. It is used for introduction of uterine manipulator. Instrument labelled as D is DOYEN’s retractor which is used in the case of caesarean section. It is not used during laparoscopy.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an advantage of hormone replacement therapy (EPRT)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Prevention of breast carcinoma

Hormone replacement therapy called EPRT has progesterone component in it and it is responsible for prevention of endometrial 
carcinoma. Hormone replacement therapy is responsible for prevention of ovarian cancer, colorectal cancer and osteoporosis as well. EPRT increases the risk of breast carcinoma because breast cancer has oestrogen as well as progesterone receptors.

questions.text: Placenta is formed from which two structures?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Decidua basalis and Chorion Frondosum

Placenta is formed from decidua basalis which is nothing but endometrium at the site of implantation and chorion frondosum which is a tertiary villous structure formed from trophoblast of the foetus. The placenta is made up of maternal as well as foetal tissue.

choices.text: The thickness is 2.5 cm at term
Weight of placenta at term is 30% of fetal weight

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about placenta?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Weight of placenta at term is 30% of fetal weight 

Placenta is a discoidal organ. There are two surfaces, foetal as well as maternal. The thickness of placenta is 2.5 centimetre at term. If the thickness is more than 4 cm then it is called as placentomegaly. The weight of placenta at term is around 500 gm. It is 1/6th of foetal weight at term.

questions.text: A 25 years old primigravida underwent USG at 28 weeks of gestation and it was found that the cord was attached to the margin of placenta instead of the central part of placenta. What type of placental abnormality is present?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Battledore placenta 

Whenever umbilical cord is seen attached to the margin of placenta instead of central part of placenta then the term used is battledore placenta. It may cause cord avulsion during the 3rd stage of labour.

questions.text: Which is the vessel that connects placental circulation to fetal heart?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ductus Venosus 

Placenta is a site of respiration. There is an exchange of gases in placenta. Blood goes back to the foetus through umbilical vein. The same vessel becomes ductus venosus in the liver. So, the correct answer is B.

questions.text: In order to identify fetal anemia, USG Doppler of which vessel must be performed?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Middle cerebral artery

Whenever there is fetal anaemia, there is hyperdynamic circulation in the fetal body. Doppler of middle cerebral artery will show increased peak systolic velocity. MCAPSV is directly proportional to the degree of fetal anaemia. When it is more than or equal to 1.5 times MOM then it means there is moderate to severe anaemia.

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida has come to the ante natal OPD with UPT positive status. On clinical examination it was found that there was bluish discoloration of vagina. What is the name of this sign of pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Jacquemier/Chadwick sign

During pregnancy there is venous congestion in the pelvis due to increase in the size of uterus causing compression effect. This is seen during speculum examination. It is called as Jacquemier/Chadwick sign.

questions.text:
Arrange the following events in the order of appearance in pregnancy?

A- lightning 

B- crowning 

C- quickening 

D- lactation
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Quickening occurs in second trimester at around 18 weeks in primigravida and at 16 weeks in multipara patient. Lightening occurs in late 3rd trimester due to engagement. Patient is able to breathe better due to reduction in diaphragmatic pressure. Crowning occurs during the second stage of labour. Fetal scalp is visible without separating labia. Lactation occurs in postpartum period.

questions.text: Which of the following would be qualified as probable diagnosis of pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hegar sign 

Probable diagnosis of pregnancy would be due to signs of pregnancy e.g. Hegar sign which is nothing but softening of isthmus. It is seen between 6 to 10 weeks. Symptoms of pregnancy, for example amenorrhoea would be qualified as presumptive diagnosis. Fetal heart sound heard on auscultation would be qualified as positive diagnosis of pregnancy.

questions.text: In order to calculate a gestational age of a patient the best parameter is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

CRL of T1

The best parameter for calculating the gestational age of pregnancy is CRL of first trimester. The best time is 7 to 9 weeks. The error is 3 to 5 days only.

choices.text: Apex beat in 6th intercostal space in third trimester

questions.text: Which of the following is a normal physiological finding in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Decreased blood viscosity 

Grade 3 systolic murmur is not considered as physiological because it is harsh systolic murmur. Cardiac output goes on increasing in pregnancy due to increase in stroke volume and heart rate. Apex beat is found in 4th intercostal space in 3rd trimester due to pressure on the diaphragm caused by growing uterus in pregnancy. There is hemodilution due to increase in plasma volume hence there is decreased blood viscosity which improves the placental perfusion so this is physiological finding in pregnancy.

choices.text: Increase blood pressure from pre-pregnancy state

questions.text: Which of the following is not a pathological finding in pregnancy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Reduced blood CO2 levels

Physiologically blood pressure falls in pregnancy due to vasodilation. There is increase in tidal volume due to deep breathing hence blood O2 levels are increased blood CO2 levels are reduced and this increment in tidal volume is compensated by reduced expiratory reserve volume.

questions.text: A 32 years old patient - day four of delivery in a postpartum state, has very low T3 very low T4 and very low TSH.  Which of the following suits the given clinical condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sheehan syndrome 

Reduced TSH levels would mean pituitary failure. It is seen in Sheehan syndrome. It is treated by thyroxin.

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida has come to ANC OPD. Her last menstrual period was on the third of January and her passed menstrual cycles were of 32 days each. Calculate the due date of this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

14th of October 

For calculating the due date, we use Naegle’s rule. LMP plus 9 months 7 days plus 4 days where 4 would be deviation from 28. In this case, the patient has history of past cycles of 32 days each. So, we need to add four days to get the exact EDD. So, the correct answer is 14th of October.

questions.text: A 32 years old patient is third time pregnant. Her first pregnancy resulted in full term twin delivery. Both the babies are alive and well. Her second pregnancy was a still-birth delivery at 32 weeks of the gestation. What is her obstetric formula?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

G3P2A0L2 

This patient had one full term twin delivery and one still birth delivery at 32 weeks so her parity is two. She is pregnant for third time so gravida G = 3. She has two alive babies from the first pregnancy so L will be 2 so the correct answer is G3P2A0L2

choices.text: It is a confirmatory test for trisomy and monosomy
Sensitivity of this test is 99% for trisomy
Cell free fetal DNA is evaluated in NIPT

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about NIPT?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

B and C

NIPT is non-invasive prenatal test. It is the most sensitive screening test for trisomy with sensitivity of 99% or more. It is not a confirmatory test because there is false positivity of 0.1 percent. In this test, cell free fetal DNA is evaluated and it is obtained from maternal blood. So, the correct answer is D.

questions.text: Gestational choriocarcinoma with bluish green vaginal nodule will be qualified as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Stage two 

Gestational choriocarcinoma with vaginal nodule would mean vaginal metastasis. Involvement of other genital organs like vagina, ovary or fallopian tube would be qualified as stage two GTN.

questions.text: Which one of the following biochemical markers is not raised in a case of preeclampsia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

VEGF

In a case of pre-eclampsia, vasodilators are reduced and vasoconstrictors are increased. Thromboxane A 2, PGF 2 alpha and sflt-1 are responsible for vasoconstriction. VEGF is a vasodilator and it is reduced in preeclampsia.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a risk factor for preeclampsia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Smoking

Smoking is not a risk factor for preeclampsia. Smokers have less oestrogen in their body and hence smokers have less risk of estrogenic diseases like fibroid, endometrial hyperplasia and endometrial carcinoma and preeclampsia.

choices.text: 4 g IV in 20% solution +5 g i.m. in 50% solution in each buttock
4 g IV in 50% solution +5 g i.m. in 20% solution in each buttock
4 g IV in 20% solution +10 g i.m. in 50% solution in each buttock
4 g IV in 50% solution + 10 g i.m. in 20% solution in each buttock

questions.text: Which one of the following is correct regarding Pritchard regime’s loading dose of magnesium sulphate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

4 g IV in 20% solution +5 g i.m. in 50% solution in each buttock 

Pritchard regime is made up of loading dose of 14 gram = 4 g IV in 20% solution +5 g i.m. in 50% solution in each buttock. Maintenance dose is given at the rate of 5g every four hours intramuscularly.

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs is used in the prevention of preterm labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Progesterone

Nifedipine, Terbutaline, Indomethacin, Atociban and magnesium sulphate are tocolytic agents used in the treatment of preterm labour. Progesterone is used in prevention of pre term labour in cases where there is past history of preterm labour or in cases in whom cervical length is less than 2.5 centimetre. It is not used in the treatment of preterm labour.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not possible in twin gestation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

DCMA

In twin pregnancy, if placenta is 1 and amniotic sacs are 2 then it is called as MCDA twinning. It is not possible to have two placentae but one amniotic sac. So, DCMA twinning is not possible because outer cell layer is formed earlier than amniotic sac.

questions.text: A 32 years old gravida3 para2 living2 patient has twin gestation with USG suggestive of lambda sign at 14 weeks of gestation. When is the right time to deliver such patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

38 weeks 

Lambda sine would suggest DCDA type of twinning. Ideal time of delivering DCDA twins is 38 weeks, for MCDA twin, delivery is done at around 36 weeks and for MCMA twins, delivery is done at around 34 weeks.

questions.text: Cordocentesis for fetal anemia is indicated if middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity is more than equal to how many times multiples of median?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1.5 times 

If middle cerebral artery peaks systolic velocity is more than or equal to 1.5 times multiples of median then it means moderate to severe anaemia. It requires correction by intrauterine blood transfusion for which cordocentesis is done.

questions.text: What should be the mode of delivery in DCDA twins with breech-transverse presentation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Caesarean section at 38 weeks 

May the type of twin be DCDA or MCDA, if the presentation is such that the first baby is in non-cephalic presentation then the mode of delivery should be caesarean section. So, correct answer in this case is caesarean at 38 weeks. We attempt vaginal delivery only if the first baby is in cephalic presentation.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a component of biophysical profile?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

DFMC 

Biophysical profile is Ultra Sonography For 30 mins. It is also called as Manning’s score. It consists of five components and these components are foetal breathing, foetal tone, gross body movements, amniotic fluid: single deepest pocket and NST. Daily fetal movement count is not included in biophysical profile.

questions.text: When is the right time to switch over to heparin therapy in a patient who is on warfarin therapy for prosthetic heart valve?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

36 weeks 

Warfarin is a long acting drug. So, we need to switch over to heparin at 36 weeks of gestation. This step is essential to prevent PPH during labour. Heparin is a short acting drug and it is stopped during labour.

questions.text: Calculate the Bishop’s score if cervix is 40?faced, two cm dilated, soft in consistency, anterior in position and fetal head is at station -2.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

7

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs is not used for induction of labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Prostodin 

The drug of choice for induction of labour in a patient with favourable cervix is oxytocin. The drug of choice in a patient in whom cervix is not favourable is PGE1 which is also called as misoprostol. Second best drug would be Dinoprostone which is PGE2. We should never use PGF2 alpha which is also called as prostodin or carboprost for induction or even augmentation of labour because it will cause strong contractions of upper and lower segment causing fetal distress.

questions.text: Identify the wrong dose of misoprostol:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

100 mcg for augmentation of lab

Misoprostol is PGE 1. It is used for induction of labour. The dose is 25 micrograms vaginally or 100 micrograms orally. It is also used the prevention of PPH and the dose is 400 to 600 microgram and for treatment of PPH, the dose is 800 to 1000 microgram. It is never used for augmentation of labour. The only drug which is used for augmentation of labour is oxytocin.

questions.text: The given cardiograph is seen due to what condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

head compression in labour 

In this cardiotocography, there are decelerations seen with every contraction. The type of deceleration is gradual type. Since it is occurring with contraction, it is called as early deceleration. It is due to head compression in labour and it is a physiological type of deceleration.

choices.text: After 24 hours up to six weeks postpartum
After 24 hours till nine weeks postpartum

questions.text: Postpartum bleeding is called as secondary PPH if it occurs:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

After 24 hours till 12 weeks postpartum 

Postpartum haemorrhage is of two types: primary PPH occurs within 24 hours of delivery and secondary PPH occurs after 24 hours of delivery till 12 weeks of delivery. It is also called as late onset PPH.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not included in the WHO guidelines for prevention of perineal tear during second stage of labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Routine episiotomy

For the prevention of perineal tears, WHO recommends the following things: perineal support, perineal massage, hot fermentation, prevention of premature extension of fetal head and avoiding routine episiotomy. We give selective episiotomy in selected few cases only.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a component of AMTSL guidelines?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Uterine massage

AMTSL guidelines are given to us by WHO. The aim is to prevent PPH. The drug of choice is oxytocin which can be given intramuscularly or intravenously (in diluted form). After oxytocin therapy, we do delayed-cord-clamping followed by controlled cord traction. Uterine massage is no longer recommended in AMTSL.

questions.text: Which of the following muscles is not cut during mediolateral episiotomy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

External anal sphincter

When medio lateral episiotomy is given, perineal muscles are cut by episiotomy scissor. The muscles which are cut are bulbospongiosus, superficial and deep transverse perinei and levator ani muscles. Most common episiotomy is medio lateral episiotomy. It has less risk of extensions to anal sphincter.

questions.text: Which one of the following is most specific marker of true labour pains?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cervical dilation 

True labour pains are characterised by lower abdominal pain radiating from back to front, uterine contractions which increase with time, cervical dilation and SHOW. Out of all these markers, cervical dilation is the most specific marker of true labour pains.

questions.text: Identify the following obstetrical examination:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Deep pelvic grip

In this picture, you can see the examiner is standing on the right-hand side of the patient and examiner is facing the leg-end of the table. Examiner is using both the hands in order to identify engagement. This is called as Leopold grip 4. It is also called as deep pelvic grip. If the hands converge in front of the head then we would say that the head is not engaged and if the hands remain parallel then we would say that the head is engaged.

choices.text: Most common position of fetus during engagement is LOT
Most common attitude during engagement is flexion

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about fetus in uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Most common malposition is LOP

During engagement, the most common position is LOT which is seen in 40% of the cases. The most common attitude is partial flexion with the diameter of sub-occipitofrontal which is equal to 10 cm. 95% of the cases have cephalic presentation. 3-4

questions.text: During labour process (without epidural analgesia), prolonged second stage of labour would be declared if primigravida crosses ____number of hours in second stage.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

3 hours 

If epidural analgesia is given then the second stage of labour prolongs by one hour. So, in primigravida the maximum duration would become four hours and in multipara the maximum duration would become three hours. If this duration is crossed then we would use the terminology called prolonged second stage of labour. If epidural is not given then the duration is three hours for nulliparous patient and two hours for multiparous patient so the correct answer in this question is B.

questions.text: Identify the given type of pelvis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Anthropoid pelvis 

This pelvis is antero-posteriorly oval. It has an egg-shaped inlet. It is called as anthropoid pelvis. It is the deepest pelvis known.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a contraindication for vacuum delivery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

IUGR 

Vacuum must not be applied in preterm babies because there is high risk of injuries to the foetal skull. HIV and fetal coagulopathy are contraindications for all instrumental deliveries. IUGR is not a contraindication for vacuum or forceps delivery.

choices.text: The blades should be equidistant from coronal suture
Head of the baby must be engaged
Bladder and rectum should be empty
Cannot be applied if cervix is not fully dilated

questions.text: Regarding forceps delivery, which one of the following is not correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The blades should be equidistant from coronal suture 

Forceps must be applied in such a way that the blades fall on the parietal bones and sagittal suture should be in the central part which means that the blades must be equidistant from the sagittal suture. Application of forceps would require fully dilated cervix and engaged head. Bladder and rectum must be empty.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not seen in a case of bicornuate uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

infertility 

In a case of bicornuate uterus, there are two horns due to partial fusion of Mullerian ducts. Due to this anomaly, there is a chance of abortion, pre term labour and malpresentations but there is no chance of infertility due to same. Transverse lie is also possible in a case of bicornuate uterus. It is not possible in unicornuate or didelphys uterus.

questions.text: 5-Alpha reductase deficiency is a case of?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Male pseudo hermaphrodite 

5 Alpha reductase deficiency leads to deficiency of dihydro testosterone. Genetically male baby would be born as phenotypically female baby. So, this is the case of male pseudo-hermaphrodite. It is also called as male intersex.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not an activator of HPO axis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

GABA

HPO axis is suppressed by GABA and neuropeptide Y. It is activated by Kisspeptin, glutamate and leptin during puberty.

questions.text: Arrange the following in a proper sequence of appearance in puberty:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

THELARCHE—PUBARCHE—ADRENARCHE—MENARCHE

The correct sequence during puberty is THELARCHE—PUBARCHE—ADRENARCHE—MENARCHE. Thelarche would mean breast budding. Growth spurt occurs just before thelarche so it is the earliest sign of puberty. However, it is not mentioned in the question.

questions.text: A 27 years old phenotypically female patient has had premature menopause. What should be the next line of investigation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

karyotype 

Whenever menopause occurs before the age of 40 years, it is called as premature menopause. It is also called as primary ovarian insufficiency. The most common cause is genetic. If menopause occurs before the age of 30 years, we must do karyotype in order to rule out presence of genetic material of Y chromosome. If there is any such genetic material then we need to do gonadectomy in order to prevent gonadal cancer.

questions.text: Which one of the following drugs would not be used in the treatment of PCOS?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Danazol

PCOS is an anovulatory disorder. Letrozole is the drug of choice for induction of ovulation in PCOS. Metformin is used for improving insulin sensitivity. Myoinositol is also used for the same. We never use danazol in PCOS because danazol is an androgenic drug. It will worsen the symptoms of PCOS.

choices.text: It can cause hypotension and shock
Most common cause is gonadotropin therapy
PCOS is a high risk for development of this condition
GnRH antagonist therapy may cause this condition

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about the given clinical condition with the given sonography?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

GnRH antagonist therapy may cause this condition

This is a picture of ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. It is due to gonadotropin therapy most commonly. It increases VEGF in the body which leads to increase in vascular permeability causing intravascular dehydration. PCOS is a high-risk for development of this condition. GnRH antagonist therapy is used for prevention and treatment of this condition.

questions.text: Identify the clinical condition for which the given surgery is done?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stein Levinthal syndrome 

This is a laparoscopic picture showing bulky and pearly white ovaries. Laparoscopic ovarian drilling is done. It is a method of ovulation induction by surgical means. PCOS is also called as STEIN LEVINTHAL syndrome.

questions.text: The probability of achieving pregnancy in one menstrual cycle is called as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Fecundability 

The probability of achieving pregnancy in one menstrual cycle is called as fecundability. The probability of achieving live birth from the pregnancy from one menstrual cycle is called as fecundity.

choices.text: LH FSH levels are very low
PCOS is the most common cause
Drug of choice is hormone replacement therapy plus we need to do ovum-donation IVF

questions.text: Which one of the following is a feature of class 1 anovulatory disorder?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

LH FSH levels are very low 

Class 1 anovulatory disorder is hypogonadotropic hypogonadism condition. LH and FSH levels are very low and hence oestrogen and progesterone levels are very low. Example of this condition is Sheehan syndrome. We need to give gonadotropin therapy for stimulation of the ovary in this case. PCOS is class two anovulatory disorder and class three anovulatory disorder is premature menopause for which ovum donation IVF is required. So, the correct answer is A.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a test for ovarian reserve evaluation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Serum LH

Serum AMH is directly proportional to the ovarian reserve just like serum Inhibin B. These hormones are produced by granulosa cells. Antral follicle count Is transvaginal sonography done in early follicular phase. If the count is less than 5 then it means ovarian reserves are poor. Serum LH is not used as ovarian reserve tests but serum FSH is used as ovarian reserve test.

questions.text: The most common cause of death in a case of carcinoma of cervix is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Renal failure 

The most common cause of death in a case of carcinoma of cervix is renal failure due to ureteric obstruction caused by lateral spread of carcinoma of cervix into parametrium.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Granulosa cell tumour---- alpha-fetoprotein 

Granulosa cell tumour has a tumour marker called inhibin. Alpha fetoprotein is a tumour marker of endodermal sinus tumour which is also called as yolk sac tumour.

questions.text: In a vaginal cytology of ovulatory patient, the maturation index on the day of ovulation will show predominance of which cells?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Superficial

May the patient be ovulatory or anovulatory there is always predominance of oestrogen in mid cycle in reproductive age group. Estrogenic predominance leads to proliferation of superficial cells of vaginal epithelium. Superficial cells are also called as eosinophilic cells because these cells are full of cytoplasm.

choices.text: Hyperflexion of legs at hip joints

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a part of management of shoulder dystocia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Fundal pressure

The earliest manoeuvre used to treat shoulder dystocia is Mc Roberts manoeuvre. In this method, we perform hyperflexion at hip joint. Then we add supra pubic pressure. Fundal pressure is prohibited in management of shoulder dystocia. There are other manoeuvres like Rubin’s technique, Woods Corkscrew Method, Gaskin Method and Zavanelli method used in the treatment of shoulder dystocia.

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions cause ambiguous genitalia at birth?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

21-hydroxylase deficiency

21 hydroxylase deficiency is responsible for congenital adrenal hyperplasia. It is the most common cause of CAH. It is also the most common cause of ambiguous genitalia at birth. In all other cases mentioned the question, there would be phenotypically female foetuses.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a part of management of breech delivery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gaskin method

Breech delivery is conducted by ABD method, also called as assisted breech delivery. If the legs are extended then Pinard method is used, if the arm is extended then Lovset method is used and for delivery of the after coming head of the foetus many methods are available like Burns Marshall method, MSV method, Bracht method, Piper forceps method and if nothing works out then Zavanelli method is used. Gaskin method is used for delivery of shoulder dystocia.

questions.text: What must be the cause of the following graph of a patient in labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cord compression

In this graph of CTG, there are variable decelerations seen. These decelerations are due to umbilical cord compression. These decelerations are sudden type of decelerations seen in cases of cord prolapse, oligohydramnios, ARM and cord around neck

questions.text: Which diameter is being evaluated in the following picture?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

DC at inlet

In this picture, clinical pelvimetry is being performed. Distance between sacral promontory and lower border of pubic symphysis is being measured. This distance is called as diagonal conjugate at inlet. It is approximately 12 cm in size. DC-1.5 = OC. OC (obstetric conjugate) is the most critical diameter at inlet.

choices.text: The draining lymph nodes for vulva is iliac lymph nodes
Labia minora originates from genital swellings
Bartholin’s glands are homologous to bulbourethral glands in males
The pH of Bartholin duct’s secretion is 4 to 4.5

questions.text: Which of the following is true about anatomy of external genitalia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Bartholin’s glands are homologous to bulbourethral glands in males

Labia minora originate from genital folds. Homologous counterpart would be penile urethra. Labia majora originate from genital swelling. Homologous counterpart would be scrotum. pH of Bartholin duct secretion is alkaline. The draining lymph nodes for vulva would be inguinal lymph nodes. Bartholin glands are homologous to Cowper’s glands and Cowper’s glands are also called as bulbo urethral glands in males.

questions.text: Which one of the following cases is not having uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

46XY with androgen receptor deficiency

46XY with androgen receptor deficiency is also called as androgen insensitivity syndrome. It is an X link recessive disease with deficiency of androgen receptors. Genotypically, the baby is male but phenotypically the baby is female. Gonads are undescended testes. Mullerian ducts are absent and hence uterus is absent in these babies.

questions.text: A 13-year-old young girl presents in the casualty with acute pain in the lower abdomen. She has history of cyclical pain for last 6 months and she has not attained her menarche yet. On local genital examination, tense bulge in the region of hymen was seen. The most probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Imperforate hymen

Presence of bluish bulging perineal membrane with cryptomenorrhea symptoms would point towards imperforate hymen. It is the most common cause of cryptomenorrhea. The treatment of choice is cruciate incision.

choices.text: Monthly USG obstetrics for cervical length assessment

questions.text: G2P1L1 with 16 weeks of gestation has history of preterm birth in last pregnancy @28 weeks. In this pregnancy it was found that she has cervical length of 2 cm in USG. What should be the plan of action?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cervical cerclage + progesterone therapy

In this case, there is history of preterm birth in last pregnancy and her cervical length is less than 2.5 centimetre which means that there is shortening of cervix. In such cases we perform cervical cerclage operation and we give vaginal progesterone support till term gestation.

choices.text: Fetal urine is the most predominant source of amniotic fluid in later half of pregnancy
Fetal lungs are the second most important source of amniotic fluid in later half of pregnancy
It is golden in colour due to Rh incompatibility
It is dark brown (tobacco juice) in colour in post term pregnancy

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true regarding amniotic fluid?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

It is dark brown (tobacco juice) in colour in post term pregnancy

Amniotic fluid is dark brown in colour in a case of IUFD. In a case of post term pregnancy, the colour of amniotic fluid is greenish yellow.

choices.text: Normal endometrial phase in secretory phase
Early pregnancy with double decidual sac sign

questions.text: The given sonographical picture is seen in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Normal endometrial phase in secretory phase

This is a picture of uterus in sagittal view. There is presence of uniformly thickened endometrium which is a marker of secretory phase of endometrial cycle. It is due to progesterone. It is seen in second half of the cycle.

questions.text: Anteversion of uterus is maintained by?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Round and uterosacral ligament

Uterus is anteverted anteflexed due to round ligaments pulling the uterus in forward direction and uterosacral ligaments pulling the uterus at the level of isthmus in backward direction. This position helps in preventing prolapse of uterus.

questions.text: The following instrument is used in which surgical procedure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Myomectomy

This is Bonney’s myomectomy clamp. It has two pairs of rings. It is used to occlude the uterine vessels during the surgery thereby reducing the blood loss during surgery.

choices.text: Invasion of spiral arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast
invasion of spiral arteries by villous cytotrophoblast
Invasion of radial arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast
Invasion of radial arteries by interstitial cytotrophoblast

questions.text: There is physiological vasodilation in pregnancy. The reason for the same is cytotrophoblastic invasion into the maternal vessels. Which of the following is considered as the 2nd wave of invasion which happens at 16 weeks?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Invasion of radial arteries by intravascular cytotrophoblast

Spiral invasion is the first wave of invasion and radial invasion is the second wave of invasion.

choices.text: In case of cordocentesis for fetal anemia in Rh-negative, ICT positive patient
In case of Rh-negative patient who delivered Rh negative neonate
Before ECV in Rh negative, ICT negative patient
In a case of Rh negative at 28 weeks with partner blood group Rh negative

questions.text: In which of the following cases will you give injection ANTI-D?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Before ECV in Rh negative, ICT negative patient

Anti-D injection is given to prevent isoimmunisation. It is useful in a patient who is ICT negative. It is not given if ICT is positive or if the neonate is negative or if the partner is negative.

choices.text: Make it 2 IFA pills per day
Stop IFA pills and give 2nd generation injectable iron
Give 2nd generation injectable iron and continue 1IFA pill per day

questions.text: A 28 years old G4P3L3 with 36 weeks of gestation has iron deficiency anemia with haemoglobin 8gm%. She is taking 1IFA pill per day. What should be your treatment plan?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Stop IFA pills and give 2nd generation injectable iron

Mild to moderate anaemia in late third trimester is an indication of injectable iron therapy. Polytherapy is not allowed in iron deficiency anaemia so we must stop IFA pill and then start injectable iron therapy.

questions.text: In a pregnancy, if there is lateral implantation of the zygote on the uterine wall then it leads to asymmetric enlargement of the uterus. This sign of pregnancy is called as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

PISKACEK SIGN

Most common site of implantation is posterior wall near the fundus but if the implantation occurs on the lateral wall then there would be an asymmetrical uterus in first trimester between 6 to 10 weeks. This sign is called as Piskacek sign. It is also called as angular pregnancy.

questions.text: A 26 years old G2P1L1 with 18 weeks of gestation underwent “quadruple marker” test. Her B-HCG was 1.3 MOM, AFP was 4.5 MOM, UE3 was 0.9 MOM and inhibin A was 1.1 MOM. What should be the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ultrasound

In this case, alpha fetoprotein level is more than 2.5 times MOM. It means that the screening test for neural tube defect is positive and we must do a confirmatory test called as 3D ultrasound.

questions.text: Identify the structure marked as black arrow:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Amniotic sac

This is a picture of double bleb sign. Big black arrow Is pointing towards amniotic sac. Big white arrow is pointing towards yolk sac and small white arrow is pointing towards embryonic disc.

questions.text: A 72 years old patient has enterocoele, rectocoele with UV descent of third degrees. Which one of the following is not a part of surgery in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Repairing pubo-vesical fascia

This patient has a prolapse of apical compartment as well as posterior compartment. There is no prolapse of anterior compartment hence there is no need to repair pubo-vesical fascia which is repaired in a case of cystocele.

questions.text: In a patient with WHO category 3 anovulatory disorder causing infertility, the treatment of choice is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ovum donation plus IVF therapy

WHO category three anovulatory disorder would mean hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It is a case of ovarian failure and the treatment of choice is hormone replacement therapy + ovum donation IVF therapy.

choices.text: Repeat PAP after 3 years (routine follow up)

questions.text: A 23 years old nulliparous patient has undergone PAP smear which shows ASC-US. What is the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Repeat PAP annually for 2 years

Young patient with age less than 25 years with ASCUS report must be followed up by annual pap smear evaluation for coming two years. If both the reports come out normal then the patient is subjected to routine follow up. This protocol is applicable only in the patient whose age is less than 25 years. If the age is more than or equal to 25 years then HPV-DNA testing is recommended.

choices.text: Preterm birth before 34 weeks due to severe pre-eclampsia

questions.text: Which one of the following is not in the diagnostic criteria of APLA syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1 abortion of <10 weeks

For the diagnosis of APLA syndrome, clinical criteria are as follows: vascular thrombosis, three or more abortions of less than 10 weeks, one or more fetal death of 10 weeks or more, preterm delivery of less than 34 weeks due to IUGR or severe preeclampsia. Laboratory criteria include: LA, ACLA and anti beta2 glycoprotein1 antibody.

choices.text: Red degeneration of fibroids should be treated by myomectomy.
FIGO (2-5) plus heavy menstrual bleeding with uterine size of 16 weeks should be treated by laparoscopic myomectomy in a young patient
FIGO 0 with post-menopausal bleeding should be treated by medical management
Endometrial ablation therapy is allowed for menorrhagia due to fibroid in an infertile woman

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the management of fibroid uterus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Endometrial ablation therapy is allowed for menorrhagia due to fibroid in an infertile woman.

Red degeneration of fibroid is conservatively treated. It is due to venous thrombosis in pregnancy. Transmural fibroid is FIGO 2-5. It is removed by laparoscopic surgery. FIGO-0 causing postmenopausal bleeding should be treated by hysteroscopic myomectomy. Ablation therapy is not done in patients who have not completed their family.

questions.text: Which contraceptive is made up of third generation progesterone?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nexplanon

3rd generation progesterones are cardio protective progesterones e.g.  DESOGESTREL, GESTODENE AND NORGESTIMATE. Nexplanon is an implant progesterone which contains 3-KETODESOGESTREL. It is a 3rd generation progesterone.

questions.text: A 72 years old post-menopausal patient has bleeding per vaginum since last 3 months. On speculum examination, there was 1 cm sized growth on the posterior lip of cervix. Which one of the following is the next best line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Direct punch biopsy

Any patient with postmenopausal bleeding and with visible cervical growth on the cervix seen on speculum examination would require direct punch biopsy for the diagnosis of the disease. Biopsy is a confirmatory test for carcinoma of cervix.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is not a reason of hirsutism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Swyer syndrome

Hirsutism is an abnormal male-like hair growth seen in PCOS, CAH, adrenal tumours, ovarian tumours exogenous androgenic drug usage as well as idiopathic cause. It is not seen in Swyer syndrome. Swyer syndrome is phenotypically female genotypically male person with SRY gene defect (point mutation).

questions.text: A new born baby was born with the following external genitalia. Which of the following is not a likely cause in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Swyer’s syndrome

This is a case of ambiguous genitalia at birth the most common cause is CAH. It is also seen in Reifenstein syndrome which is partial AIS. Ovo-testicular syndrome is true hermaphrodite condition. Baby will be born with ambiguous genitalia. In a case of Swyer syndrome, genetically the baby is male but phenotypically the baby is female. There is no chance of ambiguous genitalia in this case.

choices.text: Unicornuate uterus with rudimentary horn and Tompkin’s metroplasty

questions.text: Identify the condition and the surgery?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Uterine didelphys and Strassman’s metroplasty

This is laparoscopic picture of uterine didelphys which is being treated by cutting the medial portion of the two hemi-uteri and suturing the 2 hemi-uteri together to form 1 uterine cavity. This surgery is called as Strassmann’s metroplasty.

questions.text: A 27 years old patient underwent cesarean section due to fetal distress. This was her first pregnancy and she had a spontaneous labour at 38 weeks with cephalic presentation. Unfortunately, she had persistent variable decelerations in active labour and baby was delivered by cesarean section. According to ROBSON’s TEN GROUP classification, she will be grouped under which group?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: It is more common in COC pill users
Itching is the most common symptom

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true regarding this patient who had vaginal discharge with inflammation with the following wet mount preparation finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

pH is >4.5

This is a picture of wet mount preparation showing filaments and sports forming pseudo hyphae pattern. This pattern is seen in fungal infection like candidiasis. It requires acidic medium for growth. Hyper-estrogenic patients have high risk of development of candida infection in vagina. High dose OC pills, pregnancy, diabetes, PCOS, HIV and steroid usage are some of the risk factors. The most common symptom is itching. And pH of vagina is less than 4.5.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a feature of Ashermann’s syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Menorrhagia

Asherman syndrome is intrauterine adhesion condition. The most common cause of this condition is dilatation and curettage. It can cause recurrent pregnancy losses, infertility, hypomenorrhea, primary as well as secondary amenorrhoea. It cannot cause menorrhagia. During pregnancy it can cause placenta previa as well as placenta accreta syndrome also called as morbidly adherent placenta.

questions.text: A 63 years old, post-menopausal patient underwent Type 3 hysterectomy for carcinoma of cervix stage 1B1. Histopathology of the specimen revealed that the cancer was spread till the base of uterus. What is the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

No further treatment

Carcinoma cervix stage 1B1 is treated by radical hysterectomy which is also called as type 3 hysterectomy. In this surgery; uterus, cervix, upper one third of vagina as well as utero sacral ligaments and transverse cervical ligaments are removed. There is no need of doing any further treatment if it is found that uterus is involved in a case of carcinoma cervix because the treatment is same and it does not change the stage.

questions.text: Lady with infertility has bilateral tubal block at cornual region in HSG. The best method of management is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Laparoscopy and hysteroscopy

If HSG is abnormal then we must do diagnostic hysterolaparoscopy. During this procedure, we use methylene blue dye in order to check tubal patency. This is called as chromopertubation. It is a gold standard investigation for tubal patency.

questions.text: A lady underwent vaginal hysterectomy for Carcinoma cervix. Following the surgery after her urethral catheter was removed, she complained of urinary incontinence. On examination she has normal voiding as well as continuous incontinence. Methylene blue dye was instilled in her bladder through her urethra and she was given oral Phenazopyridine dye. After sometime, 3 cotton swabs which were kept in vagina were checked and it showed yellow staining at the top most pad, while the middle or bottom swabs were unstained. She is likely to have:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ureterovaginal fistula 

Presence of continuous wetness of genitalia would mean presence of genitourinary fistula. In this case, the upper swab is stained yellow with phenazopyridine dye which is given orally. It means she is suffering from uretero vaginal fistula. The treatment of choice is ureteric reimplantation by Boari flap surgery.

questions.text: All of the following are SLING operations for uterine prolapse except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mc Donald’s surgery

Shirodkar sling surgery is posterior sling surgery. Purandare sling surgery is anterior sling surgery. Khanna sling surgery is also an anterior sling surgery in which anterior superior iliac spine is used for slinging the uterus, Mc Donald’s surgery is cervical cerclage surgery. It is not a sling surgery.

questions.text: A 40 years old woman presented to the gynaecologist with complaints of profuse vaginal discharge. There was no discharge from the cervix on the speculum examination. The diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis was made based upon all of the following findings on microscopy except:
