questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Abundance of neutrophils

In a case of bacterial vaginosis, lactobacilli levels are reduced gram variable coccobacilli are increased. Vaginal epithelial cells become irregular due to Gardnerella vaginalis and these are called as clue cells but there is no sign of inflammation so no WBCs are seen in the smear.

choices.text: A gestational sac can be first seen 2 weeks after LMP
The accuracy of determining gestational age using ultrasound begins to decrease after first trimester
Yolk sac is the first sign of pregnancy on USG
True gestational sac is always centrally located in the uterine cavity

questions.text: A 19-year-old comes to an adolescent clinic with complain of nausea and vomiting. She did a home urine pregnancy test which was positive. She does not remember her date of last menstrual period. US shows a viable pregnancy of 8 weeks gestation. Which of the following statements regarding first trimester ultrasound is correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The accuracy of determining gestational age using ultrasound begins to decrease after first trimester

A gestation sac can be seen after two weeks of fertilisation. First trimester ultrasound is the best ultrasound for gestational age evaluation. Gestational sac is the earliest structure seen in USG. True gestational sac is always eccentrically located creating a double decidual sac sign.

choices.text: Await spontaneous onset of labour till 40 weeks.
Induce labour with amniotomy followed by oxytocin infusion.
Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 37 weeks.
Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 39 weeks.

questions.text: A third para, who had a normal vaginal delivery in her first pregnancy and an upper segment caesarean section for transverse lie in her second pregnancy, attends the antenatal clinic at 36 weeks. The presentation is cephalic. The estimated fetal weight is 2.8 kg. The birth weight of the first baby was 3.2 kg. There are no other pregnancy complications. What is the most appropriate method of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 37 weeks.

Any patient with history of upper segment caesarean section in past should be subjected to caesarean section by lower segment route at 37 weeks of gestation. The risk of rupture in such pregnancies is 9% and that is why vaginal delivery is not attempted in these cases.

choices.text: Perform amnioreduction of the sac with polyhydramnios.
Perform fetoscopic laser ablation of communicating blood vessels.
Perform selective feticide of the twin with oligohydramnios.

questions.text: An ultrasound scan is performed in a woman with a monochorionic diamniotic twin pregnancy at 24 weeks. Bladder of one twin not visible with oligohydramnios and there is polyhydramnios in the other sac. Doppler studies are normal. What is the best management option?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Perform fetoscopic laser ablation of communicating blood vessels.

This is a case of twin to twin transfusion syndrome with Quintero stage 2. In such cases, we must do laser ablation of arteriovenal anastomosis present in placenta.

questions.text: Primigravida with 30 weeks of gestation has iron deficiency anemia of Hb 8gm%. She has breathlessness and raised JVP. What would be your treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Blood transfusion

Any patients with evidence of congestive cardiac failure with anemia should be treated by blood transfusion with furosemide therapy.

questions.text: A 37 years old PRIMIGRAVIDA with a known case of type 2 DM has come to the OPD at 10 weeks of gestation. She wants to know about the complications which may occur. Which one of the following is not a possible complication in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Neonatal hyperglycemia

Infants of diabetic mother may suffer from congenital malformations, neonatal hypoglycemia hypocalcemia and hyperbilirubinemia. Diabetic mothers may suffer from recurrent abortions. In those cases where there is vasculopathy there is a chance of reduced blood flow to the placenta causing IUGR. There is no chance of neonatal hyperglycemia.

questions.text: Which one the following pairs of condition and drug of choice does not match with each other?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Treatment of atonic PPH – Carboprost

In this question pairing is done between the condition and the drug of choice. For the treatment of atonic PPH, the drug of choice is oxytocin. Carboprost is used as the last resort in treatment of atonic PPH for medical management. It is a strong bronchospastic agent and it can cause broncho spasm hence it is not used as a drug of choice in the treatment of atonic PPH.

questions.text: A 62 years old postmenopausal patient underwent endometrial biopsy. Her report is given below. What should be your treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hysterectomy
 
Endometrial hypoplasia with atypia should be treated by hysterectomy in postmenopausal patients. If there would have been no atypia then we would have treated by MIRENA.

questions.text: Male infertility with Klinefelter’s syndrome is best described as?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism

Klinefelter syndrome is a condition with testicular failure hence it is qualified as hyper gonadotropic hypogonadism.

questions.text: Identify the following tubal ligation technique:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Uchida method

In this tubal ligation procedure, tubes are ligated and cut and the medial stump is buried under tubal serosa. This procedure is called as Uchida method. It has no failure rate.

choices.text: It makes the cervical mucous thick and unfavorable for sperm entry

questions.text: Which of the following is not a mechanism of action for the given contraception?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

It inhibits ovulation

This is a 3rd generation intrauterine device called as Mirena it contains 52 milligrams of LNG. It releases 20 microgram every day. Mechanism of action is endometrial atrophy and thickening of cervical mucus. The amount of LNG entering into systemic circulation is not enough to cause LH suppression and hence inhibition of ovulation is not the mechanism of action.

questions.text: Identify the type of fibroid according to FIGO classification?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

FIGO 1 

This is saline infused sonography. We can clearly see Foley’s catheter with a bulb. Normal saline is present in uterine cavity and there is a presence of space occupying lesion in uterine cavity with mixed echogenicity, most likely fibroid. It is not a pedunculated fibroid but most of the fibroid is in the cavity so it is FIGO-1. The treatment of choice is hysteroscopic myomectomy.

questions.text: Identify the following placental abnormality:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Circumvallate placenta

This is a disorder called as circumvallate placenta. In this condition, the chorionic plate is smaller than the decidual plate and hence baby suffers from IUGR and oligohydramnios.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not the feature of borderline ovarian neoplasm aka low malignancy potential tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stromal invasion

In a case of borderline ovarian neoplasm which is also called as low malignancy potential tumour, there is no stromal invasion. Invasion is a hallmark of ovarian cancer.

questions.text:
Q168: Which of the following parameters are included in ROMA criteria for ovarian cancer?

1: CA 19-9

2: LDH

3: CA-125

4: HE4

5: POST MENOPAUSAL STATE

6: CEA
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

3,4,5

ROMA criteria also called as risk of ovarian malignancy criteria. Criteria consist of CA 125, HE4 and postmenopausal status. If the criteria are positive then we must do exploratory laparotomy.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a complication of MCDA twins?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cord entanglement

MCDA twins would have a thin septum in between. Placenta is common in the two twins. There is a chance of twin to twin transfusion syndrome due to abnormal AV anastomosis. There is a chance of twin reversal of arterial perfusion if there is death of one baby in early gestation. Pre term labour is seen in all types of twins. Cord entanglement is not seen in MCDA twins, it is seen in MCMA twins due to presence of one amniotic sac.

choices.text: It is a cerebro-protective agent for mother and baby
It acts as an anti-hypertensive agent as well
It can cause respiratory depression and arrest

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about magnesium sulphate therapy in a case of eclampsia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

It acts as an anti-hypertensive agent as well

Magnesium sulphate is a neuroprotector for mother and fetus. It prevents cerebral palsy in the neonate. It acts on NMDA receptors and hence it is anti-convulsant drug as well. It causes CNS depression and hence respiratory depression and arrest are the complications of magnesium sulphate therapy. Magnesium sulphate has no anti-hypertensive property.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a known complication of a tocolytic RITODRINE?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hypoglycemia

Ritodrine is beta-agonist. It is known to cause tremors, palpitations, tachycardia, hyperglycemia and very rarely pulmonary edema.

questions.text: A 5 years old girl has developed breasts with Tanner stage 4. Which of the following is not the possible cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

PCOS

5 years old girl with breast development would mean isosexual precocious puberty. It is due to estrogen production in the body. Granulosa cell tumour, Mc Cune Albright syndrome, hypothyroidism are some of the known causes. The most common cause is idiopathic HPO activation. PCOS is not a cause of precautious puberty at all. PCOS is a disorder of second decade or beyond.

questions.text: Identify the following pathology of uterus:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Adenomyosis 

This is a cut section of uterus showing multiple areas of blood collection in the myometrium. This is due to ectopic functional endometrium inside myometrium which is also called as adenomyosis. It is seen in multiparous patients more commonly than nulliparous patients.

questions.text: A 35 years old nulliparous patient has infertility. Her USG shows bilateral intramural cornual fibroids of four cm each and her hysterosalpingography shows bilateral cornual block. What is the best line of treatment in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Laparoscopic myomectomy 

Presence of cornual block due to fibroids would be an indication of doing myomectomy. Intramural fibroids require laparoscopic route.

questions.text: A 32 years old nulliparous patient has fibroid uterus of eight centimetric size. It is a FIGO-3 type of fibroid. She has menorrhagia since last two years. Which one of the following is not a correct treatment in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Endometrial ablation therapy

FIGO-3 fibroid is an intramural fibroid. Symptomatic patients would require medical management initially. Endometrial ablation therapy is not performed in patients who have not completed their family so the correct answer is D.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common cause of secondary dysmenorrhoea in a patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Endometriosis 

The most common cause of secondary dysmenorrhoea is endometriosis. The second most common cause is pelvic inflammatory disease.

choices.text: The size of uterus is enlarged
The most common organ involved is fallopian tube

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about endometriosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

CA 125 may be raised 

In a case of endometriosis, there is ectopic functional endometrium. The most common site is ovary. CA 125 may be raised since the serosal surface is involved. Investigation of choice is laparoscopy. Uterus is not enlarged in a case of endometriosis.

questions.text: Identify the given condition seen in laparoscopy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Endometriosis 

In this case, there is a chocolate cyst seen in one of the two ovaries. There is altered coloured blood oozing out from the ovary which would mean collected menstruation. It is seen in a case of endometriosis.

choices.text: Epidural analgesia prolongs the second stage of labour by one hour

questions.text: Which one of the following is not true about epidural analgesia in labour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Contraindicated in hypertension 

Epidural analgesia can be given even in latent stage of labour. The ideal level is T10. It should not be given in a case of hypotension. Epidural analgesia prolongs the labour by 1 hour in 2nd stage. Hypertension is not a contraindication for epidural analgesia.

questions.text: Which one of the following is correct about the hormonal status just before ovulation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

High LH High FSH

Just before ovulation there is high LH and high FSH. High FSH is due to withdrawal of oestrogen seen in mid-cycle and high LH is due to LH surge.

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about spermatogenesis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above options

Spermatogenesis occurs at puberty. One spermatogonium forms 64 spermatozoa. Spermatogenesis takes 70 to 74 days. Hormones required for spermatogenesis would be LH, FSH and testosterone. Maturity and motility are acquired in epididymis. Capacitation occurs in female genital tract. It takes 6-8 hours.

questions.text: The critical cut off to visualize cardiac activity is crown-rump length of how many cm?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

0.7 

The critical cut off to visualise cardiac activity is crown rump length of 7 millimetre which is 0.7 cm.

questions.text: The critical cut of visualize crown rump length is gestational sac size of how many mm?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

25 mm 

The critical cut off to visualise crown rump length is G-sac size of 25 mm. If G-sac is of 25mm or more but there is no CRL then it is a case of non-viable pregnancy.

questions.text: Identify the following sonographical finding in a patient whose UPT is positive and right adnexal site showed this picture:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ectopic pregnancy 

Patient is pregnant and she has adnexa with ring of fire appearance. It could be an ectopic pregnancy or it could be corpus luteum of pregnancy. In a case of ectopic pregnancy, the uterine cavity is empty.

questions.text: At 32 years old primigravida has triad of pain in lower abdomen, vaginal bleeding and missed period. Her pulse is 132 per minute and BP is 80/40mm Hg. USG is suggestive of free fluid of more than hundred cc. What is the next line of management in this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Exploratory laparotomy followed by salpingectomy

This is a case of ectopic pregnancy with hemodynamically unstable status. It is seen in a case of rupture of ectopic pregnancy. There is no role of medical management. In such cases, we must do exploratory laparotomy followed by salpingectomy.

questions.text: While doing single dose therapy for ectopic pregnancy the b-HCG value on day 7 of the treatment should reduce at least by what percentage from day 4 value?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

15% 

While doing medical management by single dose therapy, day-7 value must fall by at least 15% from day-4 value. If it has not fallen by 15% then the dose is repeated. If it has fallen by 15% or more then weekly b-hCG tests are done till we get negative report for 3 times.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a correct finding in a case of HELLP syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Raised haptoglobins

In a case of HELLP syndrome, there is low platelet count of less than 1,00,000/ microlitre. Liver markers are raised more than 40 IU/L. LDH is raised, haptoglobins are reduced and unconjugated bilirubin is increased.

questions.text: A 13 years old girl has had menarche 6 months back. She is having heavy and frequent menses since menarche. What must be the most likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

AUB-O

During puberty, abnormal uterine bleeding is most likely due to anovulatory cycles. It is qualified as AUB-O. O stands for ovarian dysfunction.

choices.text: It is made up of polyurethane

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the contraceptive “TODAY”?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All of the above

The contraceptive named ‘TODAY’ is a sponge made up of polyurethane. It is to be inserted in vagina. It is impregnated with nonoxynol-9 which is a spermicidal agent. Unfortunately, it causes micro abrasions in vaginal epithelium and hence there is increased chance of HIV transmission with the use of this contraceptive.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not used in the treatment of Sheehan syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pulsatile GnRH therapy

Pulsatile GnRH therapy is not useful in a case of Sheehan syndrome because there is pituitary apoplexy. For the treatment of infertility, gonadotropin therapy is utilized.

questions.text: Identify the following instrument:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Kielland’s forceps

The given instrument is Kielland’s forceps. It has a sliding lock which means the lock is in the shank. It is also called as rotational forceps. It is applied when the head of the baby is not rotated. The sliding lock is meant for the correction of asynclitism.

questions.text: A 27 years old nulliparous patient has come to the OPD with history of having mid cycle bleeding and unilateral lower abdominal pain for 1-2 days every month in mid cycle. What is the likely cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mittelschmerz syndrome 

This is a case of mid cycle bleeding caused by estrogen withdrawal. It is physiological condition. There is pain due to ovulation. We can give symptomatic treatment or even OC pills.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common cause of post-menopausal bleeding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Senile changes

The most common cause of postmenopausal bleeding is atrophy, which means senile changes in endometrium and vagina. Most common malignant cause would be carcinoma of cervix in India.

questions.text: A 32 years old Nulliparous patient has FIGO-5 type of fibroid. Which of the following is not the possible complication of this fibroid?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Torsion

Figo-5 fibroid is sub-serosal fibroid with less than 50% outside the uterus. Sub-serosal fibroids are known to cause compression symptoms like frequent micturition, ureteric obstruction, hydronephrosis etc. Hyaline degeneration is seen in all kinds of fibroids. Torsion is seen in FIGO-7 because it is pedunculated in nature. It is not seen in FIGO-5.

choices.text: It is done for the second baby in twin pregnancy
It is done for a singleton transverse lie in labour
It should be done in operation theatre under general anaesthesia
It is contra indicated in previous LSCS case

questions.text: A 32 years old pregnant patient has undergone INTERNAL PODALIC VERSION. Which one of the following is not true about this procedure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It is done for a singleton transverse lie in labour

Internal podalic version is possible only when cervix is fully dilated which is possible only when there is twin gestation with first baby in cephalic presentation and 2nd baby in transverse lie. Procedure is not possible in singleton transverse lie in labour because the cervix will never be fully dilated in such cases. It is an intra-uterine manipulation and hence it requires general anaesthesia. It is contraindicated in previous LSCS due to risk of rupture.

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions in obstetrics would cause bilirubinemia of only conjugated type (DIRECT BILIRUBINEMIA)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Intra hepatic cholestasis of pregnancy

Direct bilirubinemia which is also called as conjugated hyperbilirubinemia would be seen due to obstruction to bile flow or due to intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy where biliary canalicular system is dilated. All other conditions are known to increase unconjugated bilirubin as well. In a case of HELLP syndrome, only unconjugated bilirubin is increased due to hemolysis.

questions.text:
Which one of the biochemical changes would not be seen due to PCOS?

1: High testosterone

2: High FSH

3: High LH

4: High SHBG

5: High insulin 

6: High progesterone

7: High Prolactin
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

2,4,6,7

In a case of PCOS, there is anovulation which leads to progesterone deficiency. Progesterone deficiency causes high LH levels and hence androgen levels are also increased. FSH levels are low normal, SHBG is very low due to negative feedback from androgens. There is hyperinsulinemia in a case of PCOS with insulin resistance. Prolactin and thyroid profile would be normal in a case of PCOS.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is more common in nulliparous patient than in multiparous patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Endometrial hyperplasia

Nulliparous patients are prone to develop endometrial hyperplasia and cancer because of lack of progesterone exposure which seen in multiparous patients.

choices.text: Granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

questions.text: A 6 years old girl has developed breasts prematurely. On evaluation, it was found that her gonadotropin levels are very low and Sr. inhibin levels are very high. What must be the cause of this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Granulosa cell tumour of the ovary

Low gonadotropin levels would mean peripheral cause of precocious puberty. Serum inhibin levels are high in granulosa cell tumour of ovary which is a peripheral cause of precocious puberty.

questions.text: A 32 years old nulliparous female had hirsutism, breast atrophy and clitoromegaly. On evaluation it was found that she had an ovarian tumour. It was removed and sent for histopathology exam. The following picture was seen. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Leydig cell tumour

The given picture shows Reinke’s crystals which are seen in androblastoma like Leydig cell tumour. It is testosterone producing tumour. It causes virilism in the female.
